42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Daniel Radcliffe turns 18 and gains access to a £20 million fortune from the Harry Potter films.
He plans to spend his money on modest items like books, CDs, and DVDs, not on extravagant purchases.
Radcliffe has been keeping his feet on the ground despite his growing fame and riches.
He is set to reprise his role in the last two Harry Potter films and has other projects in the works.
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Miami-Dade pretrial detention facility's "forgotten floor" houses inmates with severe mental illnesses before trial.
Inmates face charges like assaulting an officer, often resulting from confrontations with police.
About one-third of Miami-Dade county jail inmates are mentally ill, overwhelming the system.
A new mental health facility will start treating inmates in 2008, a step towards long-term treatment.
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Drivers on the Minneapolis bridge described harrowing survival tales as it collapsed into the Mississippi River.
Gary Babineau had a 30-35 foot free fall and helped rescue children from a school bus.
Rescuers worked feverishly to get 55 people into ambulances in under two hours after the collapse.
Survivors described chaos, destruction, and a "free-fall feeling" as vehicles plummeted into the river.
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88:
Doctors removed five small polyps from President Bush's colon on Saturday.
None of the polyps appeared worrisome, according to White House spokesman Scott Stanzel.
Results of microscopic examination are expected in two to three days.
Bush resumed presidential power after about two hours and plans to continue activities at Camp David.
7fe70cc8b12fab2d0a258fababf7d9c6b5e1262a:
NFL suspends Michael Vick indefinitely without pay after he admits to participating in dogfighting ring.
Vick to plead guilty to conspiracy charge, faces up to 5 years in prison and $250,000 fine.
Vick admitted to killing dogs that didn't fight well, along with two co-conspirators.
Falcons owner calls Vick's actions "incomprehensible and unacceptable".
a1ebb8bb4d370a1fdf28769206d572be60642d70:
5-year-old Youssif, severely burned, receives global support after CNN shares his story.
Family to receive free medical care in US from Children's Burn Foundation.
Parents face security risks in Iraq but are hopeful for son's recovery.
Donations can be made to Youssif's fund through the Children's Burn Foundation.
7c0e61ac829a3b3b653e2e3e7536cc4881d1f264:
Iraqi women turn to prostitution to survive and feed their children due to poverty and violence.
They risk shame and danger, with some clients soliciting them through phone calls or in markets.
Humanitarian workers say the situation is dire, with many women having no other options.
The issue is taboo, but activists are working to bring it to the government's attention.
f0d73bdab711763e745cdc75850861c9018f235d:
Tomas Medina Caracas, a key FARC rebel commander, was killed in a Colombian air attack.
He was wanted in the US for cocaine trafficking and conspiracy charges.
Medina Caracas managed FARC's cocaine sales to international traffickers.
14 dead rebels were found at the FARC camp along with arms and equipment.
5e22bbfc7232418b8d2dd646b952e404df5bd048:
White House press secretary Tony Snow to step down on September 14 due to financial reasons.
Dana Perino to replace Snow as the new White House press secretary.
Snow has been undergoing cancer treatment since his diagnosis in February 2005.
Snow's cancer has not spread according to recent medical tests.
613d6311ec2c1985bd44707d1796d275452fe156:
Empty rocket launcher tube found on Jersey City home's front lawn, prompting FBI and police investigation.
The launcher is an AT4 anti-tank rocket launcher tube, deemed no longer operable by police.
FBI's Joint Terrorism Task Force is investigating the origin and circumstances of the launcher's appearance.
The launcher was turned over to US Army officials for further examination and analysis.
017d27d00eb43678c15cb4a8dd4723a035323219:
President Bush compares Iraq war to Vietnam, warns against withdrawal.
Bush cites Osama bin Laden's quote, saying terrorists see US withdrawal from Vietnam as a sign of weakness.
Democrats criticize Bush's comparison, saying Iraq is different from Vietnam.
White House frames Bush's speech as an effort to provide context for Iraq progress report.
85f55a3e0dd672857aaaaa80954934a57b7a2fbf:
UK has experienced numerous bombings and attempted bomb attacks since the 1970s, resulting in significant loss of life.
Notable incidents include the 7/7 bombings in 2005 and IRA attacks in the 1970s, 80s, and 90s.
Various groups, including Al Qaeda and the IRA, have been responsible for the attacks.
Attacks have targeted major cities, including London, and resulted in hundreds of casualties.
77d7c8cf2a9432e395d629371a12790c563c19f7:
Carlos Alberto joins Werder Bremen for a record 7.8 million euros fee from Corinthians.
The 22-year-old midfielder had success with FC Porto under Jose Mourinho in 2004.
Werder Bremen is Carlos Alberto's fourth club in three years after Fluminense and Corinthians.
VfB Stuttgart signs Ewerthon on loan from Real Zaragoza for pre-season training.
35f0e33de7923036a97ac245d899f990bda5e242:
President Bush undergoes a routine colonoscopy at Camp David on Saturday.
Dick Cheney will serve as acting president during the 2 1/2 hour procedure.
Bush's last colonoscopy was in 2002, with no abnormalities found.
The procedure is supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb and a team from National Naval Medical Center.
2ad31cae96512af5105b9b23f9b681dc732b2605:
Magnitude 4.2 earthquake hits San Francisco area at 4:42 a.m. PT, leaving 2,000 customers without power.
Quake is classified as "light" and causes minimal damage, according to USGS.
No injuries or damage reported, says San Francisco police Captain Al Casciato.
Quake was centered two miles east-northeast of Oakland at a depth of 3.6 miles.
